Value.label: Blinking behavior
Value.Help: This is actually a double byte value. The LSB defines the total time the device needs to blink in seconds. The MSB defines the on/off interval of the blink in tenths of seconds.

Value.label: Current Overload Protection
Value.Help: Current Overload Protection. Load will be closed when 3 the Current more than 2.7A and the time more than 2 minutes

Value.label: Notification status
Value.Help: Enables automatic notifications to associated devices whenever there is a state change.

Value.label: Enable Wattage Reports
Value.Help: Enable/disable Wattage threshold and percent.

Value.label: Wattage threshold
Value.Help: The minimum change in wattage for a report to be sent.

Value.label: Wattage threshold percent
Value.Help: Minimum change in percent of wattage to send a report.

Value.label: Default Group Reports
Value.Help: Set report types for groups 1, 2 and 3 to default. Reverts to 0 after set.

Value.label: Report type G1
Value.Help: Defines the type of report sent for reporting group 1. 2 is multisensor report. 4 is meter report for watts. 8 is meter report for kilowatts. Value 1 (msb) Reserved Value 2 Reserved Value 3 Reserved Value 4 (lsb) bits 7-4 reserved bit 3 MRC (KWH) bit 2 MRC (watt) bit 1 MSRC (Current) bit 0 MRC (Voltage) The MRC(KWH) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(KWh) automatically. The MRC(Watt) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(wattage) automatically. The MSRC flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Multilevel Sensor Report Command(wattage) automatically.

Value.label: Report type G2
Value.Help: Defines the type of report sent for reporting group 2. 2 is multisensor report. 4 is meter report for watts. 8 is meter report for kilowatts. Value 1 (msb) Reserved Value 2 Reserved Value 3 Reserved Value 4 (lsb) bits 7-4 reserved bit 3 MRC (KWH) bit 2 MRC (watt) bit 1 MSRC (Current) bit 0 MRC (Voltage) The MRC(KWH) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(KWh) automatically. The MRC(Watt) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(wattage) automatically. The MSRC flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Multilevel Sensor Report Command(wattage) automatically.

Value.label: Report type G3
Value.Help: Defines the type of report sent for reporting group 3. 2 is multisensor report. 4 is meter report for watts. 8 is meter report for kilowatts. Value 1 (msb) Reserved Value 2 Reserved Value 3 Reserved Value 4 (lsb) bits 7-4 reserved bit 3 MRC (KWH) bit 2 MRC (watt) bit 1 MSRC (Current) bit 0 MRC (Voltage) The MRC(KWH) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(KWh) automatically. The MRC(Watt) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(wattage) automatically. The MSRC flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Multilevel Sensor Report Command(wattage) automatically.

Value.label: Default Group Time
Value.Help: Set time interval for sending reports for groups 1, 2 and 3 to default.

Value.label: Send interval G1
Value.Help: Defines the time interval when the defined report for group 1 is sent.

Value.label: Send interval G2
Value.Help: Defines the time interval when the defined report for group 2 is sent.

Value.label: Send interval G3
Value.Help: Defines the time interval when the defined report for group 3 is sent.

Value.label: External Button Mode
Value.Help: Turn external button mode

Value.label: Device tag
Value.Help: Device tag.

Value.label: Reset device
Value.Help: Reset to the default configuration.

Value.label: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF
Value.Help: Activate/Deactive ALL ON/OFF. Default setting: 255

Item.label: ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF active
ALL ON active / ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON active / ALL OFF active

Value.label: Auto off relay after specified time
Value.Help: Auto off relay after specified time, with the possibility of manual override - immediate Off after button push. Default setting: 0 Manual override disabled

Value.label: Auto off for relay 1
Value.Help: 1 - Time period for auto off, in miliseconds [1-65535] (0,1 s – 6553,5 s) 100ms increments 0 - Auto off disabled Default setting: 0

Value.label: Auto off for relay 2
Value.Help: 1 - Time period for auto off, in miliseconds [1-65535] (0,1 s – 6553,5 s) 100ms increments 0 - Auto off disabled Default setting: 0

Value.label: Managing the transmission of control commands to the devices from first group of associations (key 1).
Value.Help: Correct working parameter No. 6 requires settings parameter No. 15 to 1. This activates functionality double-click - Control Dimmer/Roller Shutter. Default setting: 0

Item.label: The control commands are sent when the device is turned on and off (default)

The control commands are sent when the device is turned off. Enabling the device does not send commands controls. Double click on key 1 will send ON to all devices in group 1, all dimmers set to prev.value (ex. 50%)
The control commands are sent when the device is turned off. Enabling the device does not send commands controls. Double click on key 1 will send ON to all devices in group 1, all dimmers set to 100%

Value.label: Managing the transmission of control commands to the devices from second group of associations (key 2).
Value.Help: Correct working parameter No. 7 requires settings parameter No. 15 to 1. This activates functionality double-click - Control Dimmer/Roller Shutter. Default setting: 0

Item.label: The control commands are sent when the device is turned on and off (default)

The control commands are sent when the device is turned off. Enabling the device does not send commands controls. Double click on key 2 will send ON to all devices in group 2, all dimmers set to prev.value (ex. 50%)
The control commands are sent when the device is turned off. Enabling the device does not send commands controls. Double click on key 2 will send ON to all devices in group 2, all dimmers set to 100%

Value.label: Inputs behaviour
Value.Help: In case of bi-stable switches, define their behaviour (toggle or follow). Default setting: 0

Value.label: Inputs Button/Switch configuration
Value.Help: Binary inputs type configuration. Default setting: 1

Value.label: Dimmer/Roller shutter control
Value.Help: Enable/Disable opoeration of dimmer or roller shutter devices associated to group 1. Available only when using mono-stable inputs (buttons) - Hold button 1 or double-tap for operation (only mono-stable input (button)). Default setting: 0

Value.label: Saving state before power faillure
Value.Help: Saving state before power faillure. Default setting: 1

Item.label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

Value.label: Current Overload Protection
Value.Help: Current Overload Protection. Load will be closed when 3 the Current more than 2.7A and the time more than 2 minutes

Value.label: Notification status
Value.Help: Enables automatic notifications to associated devices whenever there is a state change.

Value.label: Enable Wattage Reports
Value.Help: Enable/disable Wattage threshold and percent.

Value.label: Wattage threshold
Value.Help: The minimum change in wattage for a report to be sent.

Value.label: Wattage threshold percent
Value.Help: Minimum change in percent of wattage to send a report.

Value.label: Default Group Reports
Value.Help: Set report types for groups 1, 2 and 3 to default. Reverts to 0 after set.

Value.label: Report type G1
Value.Help: Defines the type of report sent for reporting group 1. 2 is multisensor report. 4 is meter report for watts. 8 is meter report for kilowatts. Value 1 (msb) Reserved Value 2 Reserved Value 3 Reserved Value 4 (lsb) bits 7-4 reserved bit 3 MRC (KWH) bit 2 MRC (watt) bit 1 MSRC (Current) bit 0 MRC (Voltage) The MRC(KWH) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(KWh) automatically. The MRC(Watt) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(wattage) automatically. The MSRC flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Multilevel Sensor Report Command(wattage) automatically.

Value.label: Report type G2
Value.Help: Defines the type of report sent for reporting group 2. 2 is multisensor report. 4 is meter report for watts. 8 is meter report for kilowatts. Value 1 (msb) Reserved Value 2 Reserved Value 3 Reserved Value 4 (lsb) bits 7-4 reserved bit 3 MRC (KWH) bit 2 MRC (watt) bit 1 MSRC (Current) bit 0 MRC (Voltage) The MRC(KWH) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(KWh) automatically. The MRC(Watt) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(wattage) automatically. The MSRC flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Multilevel Sensor Report Command(wattage) automatically.

Value.label: Report type G3
Value.Help: Defines the type of report sent for reporting group 3. 2 is multisensor report. 4 is meter report for watts. 8 is meter report for kilowatts. Value 1 (msb) Reserved Value 2 Reserved Value 3 Reserved Value 4 (lsb) bits 7-4 reserved bit 3 MRC (KWH) bit 2 MRC (watt) bit 1 MSRC (Current) bit 0 MRC (Voltage) The MRC(KWH) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(KWh) automatically. The MRC(Watt) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(wattage) automatically. The MSRC flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Multilevel Sensor Report Command(wattage) automatically.

Value.Help: Set time interval for sending reports for groups 1, 2 and 3 to default.

Value.label: Send interval G1
Value.Help: Defines the time interval when the defined report for group 1 is sent.

Value.label: Device tag

Value.label: Reset device
Value.Help: Reset to the default configuration.

Value.label: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF
Value.Help: Activate/Deactive ALL ON/OFF. Default setting: 255

Item.label: ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF active
ALL ON active / ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON active / ALL OFF active

Value.label: Auto off relay after specified time
Value.Help: Auto off relay after specified time, with the possibility of manual override - immediate Off after button push. Default setting: 0 Manual override disabled

Value.label: Auto off for relay 1
Value.Help: 1 - Time period for auto off, in miliseconds [1-65535] (0,1 s – 6553,5 s) 100ms increments 0 - Auto off disabled Default setting: 0

Value.label: Auto off for relay 2
Value.Help: 1 - Time period for auto off, in miliseconds [1-65535] (0,1 s – 6553,5 s) 100ms increments 0 - Auto off disabled Default setting: 0

Value.label: Managing the transmission of control commands to the devices from first group of associations (key 1).
Value.Help: Correct working parameter No. 6 requires settings parameter No. 15 to 1. This activates functionality double-click - Control Dimmer/Roller Shutter. Default setting: 0

Item.label: The control commands are sent when the device is turned on and off (default)

The control commands are sent when the device is turned off. Enabling the device does not send commands controls. Double click on key 1 will send ON to all devices in group 1, all dimmers set to prev.value (ex. 50%)
The control commands are sent when the device is turned off. Enabling the device does not send commands controls. Double click on key 1 will send ON to all devices in group 1, all dimmers set to 100%

Value.label: Managing the transmission of control commands to the devices from second group of associations (key 2).
Value.Help: Correct working parameter No. 7 requires settings parameter No. 15 to 1. This activates functionality double-click - Control Dimmer/Roller Shutter. Default setting: 0

Item.label: The control commands are sent when the device is turned on and off (default)

The control commands are sent when the device is turned off. Enabling the device does not send commands controls. Double click on key 2 will send ON to all devices in group 2, all dimmers set to prev.value (ex. 50%)
The control commands are sent when the device is turned off. Enabling the device does not send commands controls. Double click on key 2 will send ON to all devices in group 2, all dimmers set to 100%

Value.label: Inputs behaviour
Value.Help: In case of bi-stable switches, define their behaviour (toggle or follow). Default setting: 0

Value.label: Inputs Button/Switch configuration
Value.Help: Binary inputs type configuration. Default setting: 1

Value.label: Dimmer/Roller shutter control
Value.Help: Enable/Disable opoeration of dimmer or roller shutter devices associated to group 1. Available only when using mono-stable inputs (buttons) - Hold button 1 or double-tap for operation (only mono-stable input (button)). Default setting: 0

Value.label: Saving state before power faillure
Value.Help: Saving state before power faillure. Default setting: 1

Item.label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

ALARM RELAY ON - relay will turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM RELAY OFF - relay will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - relay will turn ON and OFF periodically (see param.39)

The MRC(Watt) flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Meter Report Command(wattage) automatically. The MSRC flag signals that Report Group 1 send(1) or don't send(0) Multilevel Sensor Report Command(wattage) automatically.

Value.label: Scene activation functionality
Value.Help: Only valid for the 1.9 version of FGR221. The device offers the possibility of sending commands compatible with Command class scene activation. Information is sent to devices assigned to association group no. 3. Controllers such as Home Center 2 are able to interpret such commands and based on these commands they activate scenes, to which specific scene IDs have been assigned. The user may expand the functionality of the button connected to inputs S1 and S2 by distinguishing the actions of keys connected to those inputs. For example: double click would activate the scene goodnight and triple click would activate the scene morning.
